Package com.j2igf.event

Class Time

java.lang.Object
com.j2igf.event.Time
public final class Time extends Object
This class is used to handle the Timing of the framework. It is used to get the time stamp and delta time. It is also used to get and set the timescale.
Author:
Aryan Rai

  • Constructor Details

    • Time

      public Time()
      The constructor for the Time class.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update()
      This method is used to update the time stamp.

    • getTimeScale

      public float getTimeScale()
      This method is used to get the timescale.
      Returns:
      The timescale as a float value. The default value is 1.

    • setTimeScale

      public void setTimeScale(float timeScale)
      This method is used to set the timescale.
      Parameters:
      timeScale - The timescale as a float value. The default value is 1. Negative values are ignored.

    • getDeltaTime

      public float getDeltaTime()
      This method is used to get the delta time.
      Returns:
      The delta time as a float value. The delta time is the time between the last frame and the current frame.

    • setDeltaTime

      public void setDeltaTime(float deltaTime)
      This method is used to set the delta time. It is supposed to be used by the main loop of the framework. And not by any other class.
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The delta time as a float value. The delta time is the time between the last frame and the current frame.

    • getTimeStamp

      public float getTimeStamp()
      This method is used to get the time stamp.
      Returns:
      The time stamp as a float value. The time stamp is the time since the framework started.
